posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I’ve been trying to use PathPlanner for our autonomous, but I can’t get the robot to turn right. In every other respect, the paths work fine. It turns smoothly, goes the correct distance etc. But if there’s a right turn in the path, it turns left instead. We used sysid to characterize our robot drivetrain, and got pretty good data.
I actually experienced this problem earlier this season. It turned out I had inverted the motors incorrectly. So if you are inverting the right side, try inverting the left side instead.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Does a left curve in the path ALSO make it turn left? If so, that’s weird.  If it turns right instead, then you likely have some kind of motor inversion issue

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I’ve tried doing that as well, but it doesn’t work. Still the same result.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Yeah, left turns work fine. I have found in my driveVoltage() method, if I swap the left and right voltages it will turn right. But then it only turns right. So basically the same problem.
Could you post your code, so we could take a look through it?
I’m not sure exactly what could be causing your problem, but you do have kP set to 0. I think SysID gives you a kP, so I wonder if that might be causing this problem.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I’ve tried setting kP and kD as well. That just makes the robot go haywire, not really following the path at all. So does using an actual RamseteController.

viggy96:

I’ve tried setting kP and kD as well.

Did you use the ones from SysID?

viggy96:

So does using an actual RamseteController.

What do you mean by that?

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Yeah I used the values from SysID. You can see in my AutoTrajectory class that I’m using a disabled RamseteController, as per the WPILib documentation.
Is there a reason you have this over the default ramsete?

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Using the default ramsete also makes the robot go haywire. Not following the path at all, and mostly just speeding forward until I disable the robot.

I would suspect that you likely have it characterized wrong then. If you look at the working ramsete I had, its mostly just exactly what WPILib has: https://github.com/pittsfordrobotics/RapidReact2022/blob/master/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/DrivePathing.java

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: That’s weird though that feedforward would still be (mostly) correct. I also had no problem using purely feed forward to drive before. But I wasn’t using PathPlanner back then. I was inputting a list of Pose2d waypoints to the trajectory generator and that worked pretty well.

posts.name: Oliver
posts.cooked: Your ramsete is not going to be doing very well if it is not enabled as from my understanding it does not at all account for the robot pose at all. Are you sure that all of your sensor measurements are inverted/not inverted correctly? It seems like they are not. In your constructor you are inverting the right side, but in your update odometry you are inverting the left encoder.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Shouldn’t it drive pretty darn close just based on feed forward alone? I’m sure ramsete and velocity PID on either side would help make it even more accurate, but the robot should be driving pretty close to the actual path with just feed forward.
We just made our rotational kP value negative

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Where did you input the rotational kP in your code?

posts.name: Michael Jansen
posts.cooked: This sounds like a bug with the generation. Someone made a pull request on the PathPlannerLib GitHub to fix this issue but I haven’t gotten around to releasing it yet. I’ll make a build right now and get that out. That should hopefully fix this problem.

posts.name: Gagan Bhat
posts.cooked:
Make sure the NavX is inverted.

Turning to the left should make your navx angle increase in value (positive). Like the unit circle.

accepted_answer.excerpt: This sounds like a bug with the generation. Someone made a pull request on the PathPlannerLib GitHub to fix this issue but I haven’t gotten around to releasing it yet. I’ll make a build right now and get that out. That should hopefully fix this problem.
